WHO RECOMMENDATIONS ON POSTNATAL CARE OF THE MOTHER AND NEWBORN
Balance of benefits and harms: Puerperal sepsis is an important cause of maternal mortality 
and morbidity. Ensuring basic hygienic practices is beneficial in prevention of sepsis and 
is not associated with harms. Use of medications, including antibiotics, by the mother in 
the postnatal period may carry risks for the baby. There are concerns with inappropriate
